Functions

ssize_t write (int fileds, const void *buffer, size_t count)
 write() writes "count" bytes from the buffer pointed by "buffer" into the file descripted by the file descriptor "fileds".
ssize_t read (int fileds, void *buffer, size_t count)
 read() reads "count" bytes from the file descripted by the file descriptor "fileds" and saves it into the buffer pointed by "buffer"
size_t fread (FILE *stream, void *buffer, size_t count)
 Idem to the read() function, but from the given stream.
size_t fwrite (FILE *stream, void *buffer, size_t count)
 Idem to the write() function, but to the given stream.

Detailed Description

Definitions for all UNIX Standard system calls functions.

Author:
Luciano Zemin, Nicolás Magni, Nicolás Purita

Definition in file unistd.h.

Function Documentation

size_t fread ( FILE *  stream,
void *  buffer,
size_t  count 
)

Idem to the read() function, but from the given stream.

Parameters:
stream The stream where to read from.
buffer A pointer to the buffer where the information is going to written.
count Number of bytes that will be written in the buffeer from the file.
Returns:
The amount of bytes that were successfully read from the file or -1 in case of error.

Use: 

                        if ( read(stream, buffer, VIDEO_SIZE) != VIDEO_SIZE )
                                        printf("Error: video memory could not be read\n");
See also:
fwrite()

size_t fwrite ( FILE *  stream,
void *  buffer,
size_t  count 
)

Idem to the write() function, but to the given stream.

Parameters:
stream The stream where to write to.
buffer pointer to the buffer where the information to be written is hold.
count number of bytes that will be written in the file from the buffer.
Returns:
The amount of bytes that were successfully read from the file or -1 in case of error.

Use: 

                        char * message = "Hello World!\n";
                        write(stream, (const void *)message, strlen(message));
See also:
fread()

Here is the caller graph for this function:

ssize_t read ( int  fileds,
void *  buffer,
size_t  count 
)

read() reads "count" bytes from the file descripted by the file descriptor "fileds" and saves it into the buffer pointed by "buffer"

Parameters:
fileds the file descriptor for the file where the data is going to be read.
buffer pointer to the buffer where the information is going to written.
count number of bytes that will be written in the buffeer from the file.
Returns:
the amount of bytes that were successfully read from the file or -1 in case of error.

Example 

                                if ( read(STDIN, buffer, VIDEO_SIZE) != VIDEO_SIZE )
                                        printf("Error: video memory could not be read\n");
See also:
write()

Here is the caller graph for this function:

ssize_t write ( int  fileds,
const void *  buffer,
size_t  count 
)

write() writes "count" bytes from the buffer pointed by "buffer" into the file descripted by the file descriptor "fileds".

Parameters:
fileds the file descriptor for the file where the data is going to be written.
buffer pointer to the buffer where the information to be written is hold.
count number of bytes that will be written in the file from the buffer.
Returns:
the amount of bytes successfully written in the file or -1 in case of error.

Example: 

                                char * message = "Hello World!\n";
                                write(STDOUT, (const void *)message, strlen(message));
See also:
read()
